answers.answer: Are you Diabetes?If diabetic then yes, the diabetes would cause fluctuations in the TSH.What was yr FT3 and FT4 levels?Post a bit more info and others can jump in to help.

The only tests that were run were my TSH and my A1C.The A1C jumped to 6.3 (from 5.9) in about 3 mos.  Oddly enough, my doctor has me doubling my thyroid medication every other day .125 mcg's one day and .250 the next, and since I've been doing that, my bg readings are fantastic. 70's  80's and 90's

A good thing to get yr BSL down is balsamic vinegar.I use it all the time on salads as a dressing as my partner is a Diabetic.Ask him to do your FT3 and FT4.He cant dose you on TSH alone as that can be very misleading.As for the diabetes..yes it can cause problems with the thyroid meds.Just dont take the thyroid med at the same time as the diabetes med.If it clashes then change yr thyroid med to night.
Sorry..forgot to mention....Diabetes can change too and maybe you need to increase your diabetes med.What one are you on?

I'm currently taking 500 mg Metformin at night.  I take my thyroid medication in the morning, so they shouldn't even be passing each other in the "corridor."  I'm truly hoping I don't need to increase the Metformin as I have had gastro problems for many years, and don't want to add to those issues with a higher dose of Metformin.

Have you tried any other diabetes meds?My partner is on Metformin and is in the process as we speak of trying another medication as Metformin (Diabex) was great to start with but now a year later , his BSL levels have gone up too.He originally lost 9kgs in weight when he first started on it but since then has just come to a standstill and his levels are getting no better or worse either.He does need to bring his down a bit more and lose a bit more weight but its just not happening...so think the bodys got used to the Metformin and time to try another Diabetic medication....Worth thinking about.

question: Can anybody tell me in plain language (no medical degree required) what would cause my TSH levels to fluctuate?Last 2 tests 3.65 in January and 32.65 in June.  I never skip my medication.Also, could this fluctuation have a direct impact on my blood sugar readings?Thank you.
title: TSH Level fluctuates
